metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1473 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The ADDW macro in stdio-common/vfscanf.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.21 does not properly consider data-type size during a risk-management decision for use of the alloca function, which might allow context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation violation) or overwrite memory locations beyond the stack boundary via a long line containing wide characters that are improperly handled in a wscanf call.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1473` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

eglibc-source - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc-bin - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-amd64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-armel - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-i386 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-pic - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-ppc64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-prof - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-x32 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
multiarch-support - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
nscd - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> Note that the upstream bug #16618 contains the issue of CVE-2015-1472 *and* this CVE mdeslaur> fixed in same commit as CVE-2015-1472

criterions.comment: eglibc package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.19-0ubuntu6.6').
